definition.value:
Is characterised by disturbance of consciousness and changes in cognition (memory deficit, disorientation, and language and perceptual disturbances).

The patient often shows a reduced ability to focus, sustain or shift attention and exhibits disorganized patterns of thinking, as manifested by rambling, irrelevant, or incoherent speech. At times patients show a reduced level of consciousness and disturbances in the cycle of sleep and waking.


"Understanding abnormal behavior". David Sue, Derald Wing Sue, Stanley Sue.

Is characterised by disturbance of consciousness and changes in cognition (memory deficit, disorientation, and language and perceptual disturbances).

The patient often shows a reduced ability to focus, sustain or shift attention and exhibits disorganized patterns of thinking, as manifested by rambling, irrelevant, or incoherent speech. At times patients show a reduced level of consciousness and disturbances in the cycle of sleep and waking.

children.name: suicidal behavior
children.body:
Self-destructive acts that can consist in completed suicide, attempted suicide, and non suicidal self-injury.


http://www.merckmanuals.com/home/mental_health_disorders/suicidal_behavior/suicidal_behavior.html

definition.value:
Individual or group aggressive behavior which is socially non-acceptable, turbulent, and often destructive. It is precipitated by frustrations, hostility, prejudices, etc.


http://dictionary.sensagent.com/assaultive%20behavior/en-en/

Individual or group aggressive behavior which is socially non-acceptable, turbulent, and often destructive. It is precipitated by frustrations, hostility, prejudices, etc.

definition.value:
Physical state in which a person is abnormally active.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hyperactivity

children.name: hyperactivity
children.body:
Physical state in which a person is abnormally active.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hyperactivity

definition.value: Is characterised by a period of time (lasting at least 1 week) in which the criteria are met both for a Manic episode and for a Major depressive episode nearly every day.

children.name: mixed episode
children.body: Is characterised by a period of time (lasting at least 1 week) in which the criteria are met both for a Manic episode and for a Major depressive episode nearly every day.

definition.value: Is defined as a distinct period during which there is an abnormally and persistently elevated, expansive, or irritable mood that last at least 4 days.

children.name: hypomanic episode
children.body: Is defined as a distinct period during which there is an abnormally and persistently elevated, expansive, or irritable mood that last at least 4 days.

definition.value: Dream that can cause a strong emotional response from the mind, typically fear or horror, but also despair, anxiety and great sadness. The dream may contain situations of danger, discomfort, psychological or physical terror.

children.name: nightmare
children.body: Dream that can cause a strong emotional response from the mind, typically fear or horror, but also despair, anxiety and great sadness. The dream may contain situations of danger, discomfort, psychological or physical terror.

definition.value:
The essential feature is a period of at least 2 weeks during which there is either depressed mood or the loss of interest or pleasure in nearly all activities. In children and adolescents, the mood may be irritable rather than sad.

DSM-IV-TR (american Psychiatric Association)

children.name: major depressive episode
children.body:
The essential feature is a period of at least 2 weeks during which there is either depressed mood or the loss of interest or pleasure in nearly all activities. In children and adolescents, the mood may be irritable rather than sad.

DSM-IV-TR (american Psychiatric Association)

definition.value:
Catatonic behavior marked by agitation and seemingly pointless movement.

children.body:
Catatonic behavior marked by agitation and seemingly pointless movement.

definition.value:
Is a medical term for thoughts about or an unusual preoccupation with suicide.

definition.value:
Catatonic behavior in which the person assumes a rigid position and holds it against all efforts to move him or her.


http://www.minddisorders.com/Br-Del/Catatonic-disorders.html

children.name: catatonic rigidity
children.body:
Catatonic behavior in which the person assumes a rigid position and holds it against all efforts to move him or her.


http://www.minddisorders.com/Br-Del/Catatonic-disorders.html

definition.value:
Catatonic behavior with markedly slowed motor activity, often to the point of immobility and seeming unawareness of the environment.


http://www.minddisorders.com/Br-Del/Catatonic-disorders.html

children.name: catatonic stupor
children.body:
Catatonic behavior with markedly slowed motor activity, often to the point of immobility and seeming unawareness of the environment.


http://www.minddisorders.com/Br-Del/Catatonic-disorders.html

definition.value:
The response to emotional pressure suffered for a prolonged period over which an individual perceives he or she has no control.


http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chronic_stress

children.name: chronic stress
children.body:
The response to emotional pressure suffered for a prolonged period over which an individual perceives he or she has no control.

definition.value: Behavior that may manifest itself in a variety of ways, ranging from childlike silliness to unpredictable agitation.

children.name: grossly disorganized behavior
children.body: Behavior that may manifest itself in a variety of ways, ranging from childlike silliness to unpredictable agitation.

definition.value:
Is defined as the inability to experience pleasure from activities usually found enjoyable, e.g. exercise, hobbies, music, sexual activities or social interactions.


http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anhedonia

children.name: anhedonia
children.body:
Is defined as the inability to experience pleasure from activities usually found enjoyable, e.g. exercise, hobbies, music, sexual activities or social interactions.


http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anhedonia

definition.value: Consists of episodes of uncontrollable eating.

children.name: binge eating
children.body: Consists of episodes of uncontrollable eating.
